About Me.description: This is a description of me

Education.description: Bachelor of Education, Faculty of Education / Vancouver, BC / 2021 - 2022

Major in Biochemistry / Vancouver, BC / 2014 - 2017
Co-operative Education Program / Burnaby / 2015 - 2016
Associates degree in Science, Biology / Surrey, BC / 2011 - 2013
Faculty of Education Program pre-requisites / Distance Education / Jan 2021 - June 2021

Work Experience.description:
Worked as a teacher on call in the Surrey district. I typically cover Science and BASES classes. BASES is a program that helps students with learning or physical disabilities.
  • Worked in classes such as science, math, English, and tech.
  • Developed new material for the classroom and science labs.
  • Worked with complex students to assist them in their individual needs.

• Designed a web page for the Science World website that contains compiled resources for educators to use inside the classroom, and during field trips to Science World.
  • Assisted with inquiry-based workshops for numerous grades on field trips.
  • Performed multiple chemistry demonstrations to elementary classes.
  • Collaborated with Science World administration by discussing options and limitations for the web page.
  • Rotated through various science-based galleries while assisting guests with their queries.

Work Experience.subheader: Pacific Academy / Surrey, BC / Sept 2019 - June 2021
Work Experience.description:
• Instructor for Biology 12 for two terms between April 2019 and September 2020 which includes a transition to an online format as the school closed down due to COVID-19.
  • Online video lessons taught during the pandemic period using YouTube and Google Meet.
  • Designed a teaching website, written exams, oral exams, assignments, and quizzes for two Biology courses.
  • Worked with students with health conditions and disabilities, including those on the autism spectrum.
  • Regularly assist struggling students one-on-one with classwork and homework.
  • Acted as a teacher's assistant in numerous classroom settings.
  • High school librarian: Received and signed out novels and textbooks for classes.
  • Proctored final exams during exam seasons.
